Interface EstimationFunction<N extends Number>

All Superinterfaces:
NumberTypeAgnostic<N>
All Known Subinterfaces:
LinearModel<N>, NeuralNetwork, ScalarEstimationFunction<N>, TrainableFunction<N>, TrainableScalarFunction<N>, UnaryEstimationFunction<N>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ActivationsCachedNeuron, Adaline, AssociationUnit, DefaultNeuralNetwork, InputNeuron, LastInputStoredNeuron, LinearBasisFunctionModel, LinearCombination, MultiLayerPerceptron, NearestNeighbors, Neuron, NeuronFunction, Perceptron
@DomainObject @Strategy(INTERFACE) public interface EstimationFunction<N extends Number> extends NumberTypeAgnostic<N>
The estimate(N[]) method defines the contract for mapping input values to output values according to a specific estimation algorithm. Different implementations may use linear, non-linear, or domain-specific (symbolic AI) logic.

  • Method Details

    • estimate

      N[] estimate(N[] inputs)
      Applies the estimation algorithm to the given input vector.
      Parameters:
      inputs - an array of input values (e.g., features, signals)
      Returns:
      an array of output values computed by the estimation function

    • arity

      int arity()
      Returns the arity of this function, i.e. the number of inputs (independent variables or features) it expects.

      For example:

      • A univariate function f(x) has arity 1.
      • A multivariate function f(x, y, z) has arity 3.
      • In machine learning, this corresponds to the input feature dimension.
      Returns:
      the number of inputs (arity) this function accepts

    • coArity

      int coArity()
      Returns the co-arity of this function, i.e. the number of outputs (dependent variables or results) it produces.

      For example:

      • A scalar-valued function f(x, y) → ℝ has co-arity 1.
      • A vector-valued function f(x, y) → ℝ² has co-arity 2.
      • In machine learning, this corresponds to the output dimension (e.g., number of labels or regression targets).
      Returns:
      the number of outputs (co-arity) this function produces
